cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana and 560 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest tonight, then move north-northwest and come ashore on the Upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast late Wednesday night; remnants then track northeast across Arkansas and the mid-South and reach the mid-Atlantic coast by the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border – between San Luis Pass TX and Intracoastal City LA (Lake Charles/Cameron area)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (Kansas City is an inland river port; the system does not move offshore relative to it)
cyclone.hours_of_strike: 0 (no direct strike expected at the port)

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: No (cone passes well south-east of Kansas City)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River; Tropical-Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline with surge 9-13 ft possible near and east of landfall; lesser surge into Mississippi coast and Galveston Bay
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2020-08-28 (remnant low passes south-east of Kansas City Friday)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (Kansas City not included in NHC probability table)
weather_observation.first_hazard: Start of heavy rainfall (remnant rains, not wind or surge)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely – guidance suggests 1-3 inches possible in western / central Missouri with lower totals near Kansas City
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – port is inland on the Missouri River, far from Gulf surge influence
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; breezy 20-30 mph possible as remnants pass well to the east
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate remnant rain bands could reach the mid-Missouri River valley Friday; flooding risk low but locally heavy downpours can’t be ruled out
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river level rises possible on lower Missouri/Arkansas tributaries later in the week, but no direct operational hazard anticipated for Kansas City Port Authority
